AYANA Midplaza Jakarta
8.7 Excellent
Based on 48 reviews

Fairmont Jakarta Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 425 reviews

The staffs are ok, but the managerial levels are terrible -- they don't get what a 5 stars hotel is. It's quite apparent from: 1.

How they do cheap tricks just to earn small money. (Helloww, this' NOT a 3 star hotel!) 2. The suite rooms are packed with high quality stuffs, but they don't have a descent taste of a good layout and design. It leaves no impression at all, but a wasted investment in the hand of incapable managers and GM. 3. 3rd party tenants are ok, they're one of the best Chinese, Indonesian, Italian restaurants and bar in town. However, the hotel's own swimming pool and gym are just average. Again, they don't have taste needed to take the best of the view and what a 5 stars hotel's facilities should be. I feel very sorry for the owner and the investors. If I'm them, I would definitely fire the GM right away.

Show more
Ari , Indonesia
Grandkemang Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 1180 reviews

Always a good standard. However, from my last several stays here it is clear that some of the rooms could do with refurbishment, particularly bathrooms.

Otherwise, rooms are a good size and clean. Staff are friendly and helpful; breakfast caters for all tastes. The Stanford Arms pub is a little shabby and could do with refurbishment as well. There are better locations nearbye but what the pub does offer is the convenience of being within the hotel. Other facilities in the hotel are good. Across the road is Kemchicks western supermarket with a café incorporated. A variety of good western and local restaurants are located close to the hotel along with night life. The Lippo mall complex is also 2-300 m away. World class shopping and entertainment available there. Further afield within the Kemang area there are many up-market clubs, bars and restaurants. Just ask the desk or concierge for directions or assistance.

Show more
Phillip , Australia
Pullman Jakarta Indonesia
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3768 reviews

I recently stayed at the Pullman for a two-week business trip. I booked with Agoda but did not realize that the rate did not include breakfast; my mistake! Having said that, the hotel breakfast is very expensive (about 25% of the actual cost of the room).

So remember to ensure your booking includes breakfast. My room was also very small compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Jakarta. I was told I could upgrade to a larger room for 400,000 IDR, but that would also not include breakfast! Right.... The hotel policy of only offering Silver Bird taxis is annoying. I was told it would take 15-20 minutes for a special order of a bluebird taxi, but when I went out to the street myself there were at least 3-4 taxes lined up and waiting for passengers. Also, they only allow you to register a single licence plate during your visit for pick up and drop off for free parking. I think in this day and age of modern transport apps (everyone in Jakarta uses Grab Taxi and Uber) this is a very outdated policy. Although they did agree to register my Uber cars, I was made to feel like this was an annoyance to them. So all in all, very nice overall facilities, wonderful friendly staff, but small rooms and a definite need to revisit their approach to transport options.

Show more
Caroline , Netherlands
Shangri-la Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 563 reviews

We live in Jakarta but we decided to give ourselves a treat & went to stay in the Shangri-La for a night.

We paid for the Deluxe room. breakfast was not included. When we got to the hotel, we were told that breakfast would be an additional $30 each so we decided to upgrade to the Horizon Club room. This gave us both free breakfast, a nicer room & access to the lounge all day, with a cocktails in the evening between 17.00-20.00. This also means that you can have late check-out until 16.00 on the day of your departure. This worked out very well for us because we wanted to use the pool before we left the next day. The staff were amazing from the moment we arrived at the hotel. They are very good at their jobs & could not be any more friendly. The pool and gym areas are lovely. The breakfast was fantastic. There is a very wide selection available. In the middle of breakfast we were approached by a member of staff to tell us that only one of our breakfasts was included in the price of our room & that we would have to pay for the other one separately. We had to explain to him that we had upgraded the room etc. This annoyed me because I feel like he should have checked at reception first, however, this was only a small problem in an otherwise great experience.

Show more
Louise , Ireland
Pullman Jakarta Central Park Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3711 reviews

This is my second stay at Pullman Jakarta . I looked tired after a long day meeting as I have just arrived in the morning and went straight into work.

Febi was quick to notice on my fatigue upon checking in and make sure that I have a good rest . Thank you on the free upgrade. Upon checking out the next day , Trisna also ensured on the smooth checkout and ensured that I am being taken care of . It was nice and I hope to see them again soon . Thumbs up for the great service

Show more
Yeong , Singapore
Hotel Mulia Senayan, Jakarta
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1245 reviews

In one word FRUSTRATING! How would YOU react if you are told you cannot enjoy your USD $100 bottle of wine in your USD $250 a night room? NOT ALLOWED.

And that Internet is an additional charge? REALLY? It's 2014 right? Or that your small cup of house Sake at the excellent Japanese restaurant is USD $ 25 ? Or that the room you booked direct with the hotel only includes breakfast for your wife but not for you in the same room ? Or the the room is either super cold or getting hotter every minute because the AC in your USD $250 room is not adjustable even after engineering shows up. Or that you re told to suffer through the construction noise above you because ...they did change our room after we insisted. The hotel is greedy for profit and un Come on people it'ts not called hospitality for nothing.

Show more
Gerard , Netherlands
Century Park Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 3266 reviews

Century Park is old and you notice this directly at least my room had a musty smell and I am quite sure that it's not the only room having this.

They clean the room, bed, towels, bathroom so no complains on that but the room is not clean looking in corners, under the bed, need of big improvement. I had my breakfast in the lounge on 26th, it's OK but not more. I asked to get an iron and a board to my room but apparently there was only one and it was already in some other room so the meeting first day was with a wrinkled shirt. The iron and board was in my room when I came back in the evening but not much of use for me. Part of the lights went off 3 times so my bathroom was black, seams there was a problem with a fuse maybe overload. I told the staff, they fixed it but only temporarily, annoying! I told them to fix it for next guest to come when I checked out so maybe it's OK now!

Show more
Kenneth , Sweden
Gran Mahakam Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1629 reviews

Overall is a good stay for a night. Got a non-smoking room on the 6th floor which is near the swimming pool area - good the kids.

However, when we arrive the sprinkler on the toilet was broken, the handle was loose. It got worst, when my husband went to the bathroom, he found that it had leaked the whole time and flooded the bathroom floor. This was very unfortunate since I found the room is very nice and clean. Hope the hotel staff thoroughly check all the rooms for any faults.

Show more
PUTRI , Indonesia
Le Grandeur Mangga Dua Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 3903 reviews

Their 5-Star or whatever ratings stopped at the entrance lobby. From there on, it slides down. By the time you reach their bathroom, you wonder what kind of hotel they were trying to run.

They provided just two bath old discoloured bath towels in the bathroom. Luckily, we donot normally use holet toileteries - otherwise I would have some issues with their soap too. Since we arrived quite late, we could not be bothered to request for a much needed floor towel. Much needed because their fixed and spoiled shower head was splashing water all over. Using the bathtub was not an option as they did not even bother to clean the tub - moulds and stains clearly visible. Even taking a shower was hazardous as I almost slipped when I stepped into the slippery tub. The following day, I requested for their housekeeping to at provide a floor towel. But when we got back to the hotel at the end of the day, they only supplied us with one bathtowel. I had to call housekeeping to request for an additional towel and a floor towel. I will not return to or even consider this hotel any time soon unless I see updates that a new management had taken over and complete refurbishment is done.

Show more
Nelson , Malaysia
Hotel Indonesia Kempinski Jakarta
9 Excellent
Based on 1515 reviews

Stayed here four times in the last quarter of 2016 most recently just before Christmas. The hotel is pretty and the rooms are nicely finished.

However on closer inspection you find there are no power points near the beds, no USB either (only place you can work or charge is the desk). The mini tvs in the larger bathrooms don't work. The internet is slow or if you want fast you have to pay. There is no iron and ironing board in the rooms and when you request one it takes forever (two phone calls, by which time I was late for my meeting). The room service is painfully slow. The beds are uncomfortable, Breakfast is average (poor selection of juice, and few healthy options). This hotel is a No in my book let down by amenities and poor service. The pluses are its location, the Grand Indonesia Mall access and it's public areas are pleasing to the eye. It could be a great hotel with a fresh approach and some key renovations (working power, better beds, irons in rooms, better coffee makers). The front desk staff are friendly but incompetent, e.g. I had to get my room keys re-made twice during my moar recent 24 hour stay. Getting up to my room and having to go back down (twice) simply to get keys sorted out is a huge turn off. I can't stay here again, which is a pity due its proximity to my office.

Show more
William , New Zealand
Hotel Borobudur Jakarta
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2194 reviews

Got to borobudur due business occasion, it says and was a 5 starts hotel. but its not anymore, looks more like a 3 starts hotel but big.

u can hear the sound of upper bathroom, and was surely leaking somewhere. u really can hear the drop sounds, moldy shower curtain. Strain on the bed sheet. The breakfast they provide was not ok! The Bogor Cafe couldnt handle that much guest. not enough napkins, we needed to ask more than twice for our cutlery set, had to wait about 10 minutes so they finally refill the mineral water at the drinks corner, nasi goreng was just plain, the bubur ketan item was plain and not ready to eat. i think they should cook it longer. all u see is just used plate, cups, and classes on the table.. we had to extend because work wasnt finish, and hoped that the next day would be better at the Bogor Cafe. Next day was just the same, not enough napkin, had to ask again a few times for cutleries. ( they didnt provide at the buffet ), the bubur ayam was watery, chinese fried rice too dry. I wouldnt go back for sure.

Show more
andru , Indonesia
Kristal Hotel Jakarta
7.9 Very good
Based on 353 reviews

i have known and visited the hotel over the past but never have stayed previously.Therefore it was of very great surprise when we opened the suite door and found ourselves within a very large 3 bedroomed suite .

Fantastic , very large Kitchen with adjoining lounge and dining room. 3 good sized bedrooms with lots of wardrobe and cupboard space and 2 shower /bathrooms...Lovely pool with plenty of surround area and kids playground. Dining was a treat , good standard of food,not overpriced , with a good selection of western and asian choice. My only complaint was that on checking out we had left behind a computer charger, on e mailing the hotel about this there was never a reply received from them. unprofessional i think.

Show more
keith , United Kingdom
The Park Lane Jakarta
8 Very good
Based on 1426 reviews

Service is good. I appreciate very much being accommodated for an early check in. Fantastic! For improvement purposes, if the hotel wishes to improve anyway: The lobby of the hotel uses a very strong chemical-based air freshener.

Not everyone likes this. It's toxic and cancerous. The hotel/housekeeping staff are unaware that this is very noxious. Imagine the people in the front desk smelling this every day of their working lives. This same chemical is also super-sprayed inside the room prior to the guest's arrival. Takes a long time for the strong odor to dissipate. It is very unpleasant. Molds in the shower area means there is no attention to detail. The bidet has some droppings from the previous occupant/s. (disgusting) The plywood hole where the sprinkler is, in the bathroom ceiling, is larger than the sprinkler. The air being sucked by the exhaust fan goes back to the bathroom via this hole. Makes me wonder what the exhaust was for. 10 being the highest, I'd rate the room as 5 or 6 for cleanliness. Very comfortable bed and pillows. One last bit is, I stayed in this hotel previously and suggested that they clean the aircon filter (aircon is individual - per room). I'm glad they cleaned the filter in my room. I'm allergic to dust. Right before check out, I went inside an empty (just-vacated) neighboring room down the hall to see if they cleaned the filter.....still dirty, with thick dust. I guess cleanliness is really not a priority for them. As I said on the title, manage expectations well.

Show more
LI , Singapore
Manhattan Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 3810 reviews

Room was smelly when we entered. No towels in the bathroom. Glasses and mugs in the room were incomplete and dirty.

We had to ask for all of those things. Bathtub was dirty. The spread of food for breakfast wasnt a lot and not even yummy. Motel service in a so-called 5 star hotel. Not worth the money at all. This hotel doesnt deserve its 5-star rating. It's so far from Jakarta's other 5-star hotels like Shangrila or Mulia in terms of service and facilities. Even 4 star hotels like Mercure or Millennium are much much better. Complained to the duty manager. He told me to wait for 5 minutes so he could address our complaints. The supposed 5 minute wait became 20 minutes. And it was almost midnight when he got back to us. We were not a happy bunch at all. Will never stay in this hotel again!

Show more
Worley , Philippines
HARRIS Vertu Hotel Harmoni
8.8 Excellent
Based on 383 reviews

When check-in, the receptionist (boy) little bit disappointing when i asked for information about parking area, and didn't explain anything when he gave the keycard.

But Eti (girl) really help me for check out proccess and very friendly. Need more directions sign for parking area.. confused.

Show more
Gabriela , Indonesia
ARTOTEL Thamrin - Jakarta
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1987 reviews

I stay for 4 nights at 3rd floor. Room is quiet enough for 1 person but is too loud when i open my window (room 309) , airco doesnt work very well , even tho i told front office about it ! At the weekend , i could hear still a music from rooftop (which is quiet good bar) for chill evening !!! Hairdryer is not available at the room so is kind a annoying that i have to call front office when i need it ! The restaurant (smoking section) pretty well relaxing to sit there and they do have a awesome food ! I left my document in 1 envelope , and called them to ask if they do find it ,, but took a long time for them to take an action about it , untill friend of mine called for the 2nd time and ya is still there but unfortunately the envelope is not the same like before ☹ i guess ,they thought is just a rubbish and if its so , what happen with the professional behav and trust at work place as a hotel staff ??? Anyway why my copy pasport is not even in the envelope anymore ??

Rafida , Netherlands
HARRIS Hotel & Conventions Kelapa Gading
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2564 reviews

Booked for 9 rooms, we had trouble with payments. We wanted to finish all payments 3 months before arrival, but staffs were not helpful.

Thankfully agoda helped us solve the problem Since arrival,my son had been locked out of his room twice! First it was the key card malfunction, second time was the slot chain that magically locked itself when you close the door. So many scratches around the door, telling us that the door lock had been broken multiple times. Staffs handled the complaint lazily, we waited 20 minutes in front of the room. No apologise, nothing. We asked for room change, but they won't replace our room due to full house, so we have to wait till the next day. Day 2 wasn't any better. Our groups had arrived at 1pm, but we managed to get the room by 3pm. Thankfully harris was located next to mall, so our guests could kill some time. Once we asked for room boy to help us transfer our luggage, only for disappointment he came after 5 phone calls and 30 minutes later. Overall, horrible service. On a positive note, room were good and clean, breakfast was decent.

Show more
Margono , Indonesia
The Sultan Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 2018 reviews

The location was great as I was attending an exhibition next door and it was reachable through the underground walkway.

The rooms were a bit old but well maintained and clean. They even offered two pieces of free laundryper day which was a nice bonus. Breakfast was quite good with a large selection, but being very busy at times it was sometimes difficult to find a seat. Definitely recommended for short term business travel. There are many malls nearby to get dinner and go shopping.

Show more
Sebastiaan , Netherlands
Hotel Ciputra Jakarta
7.6 Very good
Based on 2115 reviews

The hotel is connected to Ciputra Mall thus convenient for shopping and food. There was 50% off for Polo Ralph Lauren for 2 items and above during my stay :) got some good deals.

Did some self pampering by getting my hair wash and blown daily it being so affordable. Location wise it was a relative short cab ride from Central Park and also Grand Indonesia in terms of distance since Jakarta's notorious traffic is well known. The hotel room itself was spacious and clean despite it being an older hotel. The staff speaks good English, were all pleasant and helpful. They even sent an adaptor up to my room within 10mins when mine didn't work. Breakfast spread was fair and reasonable quality, the waitress even acceded to my request of double shot extra hot latte. :)

Show more
WEN , Singapore
Fraser Residence Sudirman, Jakarta
8.6 Excellent
Based on 630 reviews

I stayed combined private weekend to meet friends and for work. Nice room, very spacious so I had all space I could think of did not use half of it.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food is not fantastic but still OK, for the breakfast I have no complaints.Pool area very nice and the gym is big with all kind of equipment. Ha d a water leakage in the bathroom coming from the room above, which I reported, was looked at but they did not do anything, it was something normal it seams. Anyhow I did not have any problem with is as it was in the corner of the bathtube which I did noit use! Good place will come back. Kenneth

Show more
Kenneth , Sweden
Grand Mercure Jakarta Kemayoran
8.4 Excellent
Based on 546 reviews

First time i stay in this hotel , good hotel with glasses bathroom and nice view . But im totally angry when i check out, i consume one bottle aqua natural in mini bar and see the price was idr 25K but when i pay the hotel charge me 42K its ridiculous as they say the mini bar price are 42 K more expensive than the sparkling (35K) for me the price different its not abbig deal , but the different price in mini bar and the billing was not fair , i mever trust again with this hotel , i even dont trust in small things how can i trust in the big thing , i will never stay at this hotel anymore

aluisius , Indonesia
Grand Hyatt Jakarta
8.8 Excellent
Based on 341 reviews

tired with the traffic as there was college demonstration near by the hotel, we are welcomed by nice smiles of charming bell boys and door ladies around the lobby.

however, something surprising happened in reception area. one of the reception guys said " sorry ! we're still handling another guest " - sorry to say, but he said that sentences with unpleasant tone. there was no even smile on his face. not at all... the room is fine, great features but, at least you could give us a welcome drinks, not just 2 green apples. i appreciate a welcome drinks rather than those fruit. plus , the internet is not free..i don't mind to pay. it is just really inconvenient to take little charge of the internet access. the service in the seafood terrace was great. the staff are incredible there. smiling, charming, and knowledgeable

it was good for a one-night stay. I must say i enjoyed the room a lot (stayed in their superior room).

It's rather small but the interior made it feel very cozy. Bathroom amenities was very basic, though. There was toothbrush but no toothpaste. Shampoo and shower gel were provided but no hand soap. Hmm. The TV channels were not as various as it claimed to have, just the basic cable channels like HBO, Fox, Cinemax, MTV and Starworld and a few more. I really appreciated the public pantry. There's enough equipment to make me comfortable eating my takeaway food as there's no room service. The water dispenser helps too, I could just fill the water jug from my room and not be bothered to get more from outside. Breakfast could be improved. I wouldn't mind the narrow selection because it did state "lite breakfast" but even the scrambled egg was overcooked. Apart from it there were bread, butter, jam, coffee, tea, orange juice and local dishes (rice, sauteed veggies and some meat). To be honest I've had better-tasted meals, but I guess that would do if you only need a simple tummy filler to get your day started. The place is barely 5-minute walk to Blok M plaza, so despite not needing anything from the mall during my stay I could see it being a plus point. There were Burger King and KFC nearby too, in case you get hungry late at night. A few more cool hangout places were within reasonable distance. Meanwhile it was located on the quiet side of the road so I was happy I didn't have to listen to the crazy traffic around the area. Anyways, I do think it's value-for-money, if I had to compare the place with other hotels/inns/guest houses/serviced residences with similar price points. Would definitely consider coming back should I need a place to stay around the area again.

7 Very good
Based on 49 reviews

This is my second time staying at the hotel. This is 3 hotels grouped into one: Take's Mansion, Take's Hotel (newer and more modern) and RedDoorz which are a few smaller rooms behind the 2 others.

Staff is always willing to help and quick for requests. Always greeting you and smiling. Made my stay very pleasant. Met the owner (who lives on site) both times and a lovely gentleman. For the price and location, NOTHING beats this. It is at the end of a closed off road and I was weary at first when checking it out but the street is lit and I felt safe at all times of the day and even when walking to the hotel at midnight. The restaurant food is really good and affordable. The buffets are a bit pricey but not too bad. I stick with the plated food. Pool on both hotels are nice and the one on the higher Take's Hotel has a beautiful view of the Jakarta city. I highly advise Take's Mansion for couples while the Hotel would be better suited for families. For lone travelers or business folks that want a no nonsense place to stay....highly recommend RedDoorz or Take's Mansion. People complain of the smell from the bathroom This is typical as the sewer system is not the same as North American standards. And they do use a spray to wash yourself if you choose to. I assume all this contribute to the smell. You get use to it after a few days. Wasn't a biggie to me. You would not want to drink the tap water for fear of getting ill so brush your teeth with bottled water or boil it well first. I would not hesitate to stay there everytime in Jakarta.

My trip to the Majapahitan-city of Jakarta on 11 October 2013 was totally Majapahitan, i.e. everything was well organized.

I arrived in the Sukaerno Hatta Airport from Bandar Lampung of Sumatera approximately at 9pm on 11 October 2013. I got on a cab, and headed straight to the hotel, which was 24.3 km away. The route taken by the cab driver had a couple of tolls totaling to about Rp15000. After a 25-minutes-drive we finally arrived at Hotel Rumah Shinta, Jalan Mangga Dua Raya 41, Pinangsia, North Jakarta. The hotel phone number is 0062216905566, and website is http://www.rumahshinta.com/. The hotel is placed right in the middle of the city, i.e. Pusat Kota, and nearby the boarder line between Jakarta Barat and Jakarta Utara. At the check-in counter, I gathered info that the hotel is open for 24 hours, has a lift service for all four floors of the hotel, has a couple of 24-hours-shops nearby and has the Kota Railway station 80 meters away to the right of the hotel. The hotel staff were all smiles trough out my stay there. I left back to Malaysia on 13 October 2013. I'll be sure to return to this hotel on my next trip to the Majapahitan-city of Jakarta .

More about Jakarta

One of the most densely populated cities in the world, Jakarta is the capital of Java and the gateway to Indonesia. It's the largest city in Southeast Asia and offers some of the best hotel facilities in the world, which is convenient for all the global commerce that moves through the region.

Jakarta Airport, which is locally known as Soekarno Hatta International Airport, handles more than 30 million travelers a year and is linked to hotels in Central Jakarta via shuttle bus and taxi. The airport is only 20 kilometers from the city center, so travelers who want to stay near the airport have the option of booking a hotel near Jakarta airport.

Central Jakarta is the busiest and most compact of this city and where much of Jakarta's business and finance are conducted. Hotels in Central Jakarta are convenient to major company headquarters, high-end shopping, restaurants, bars, and culturally significant landmarks like the National Monument, locally known as MONAS.

Museums of note within Jakarta include the National Museum and the unique Puppet Museum.

After dark, the nightlife in Jakarta is most active in Central and South Jakarta, with a range of nightclubs, live music venues, and 24-hour cafés. This diverse and exciting city truly has something for everyone.

There’s much more to see and learn about Jakarta, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this city.

I booked with Agoda but did not realize that the rate did not include breakfast; my mistake! Having said that, the hotel breakfast is very expensive (about 25% of the actual cost of the room). So remember to ensure your booking includes breakfast. My room was also very small compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Jakarta. I was told I could upgrade to a larger room for 400,000 IDR, but that would also not include breakfast! Right.... The hotel policy of only offering Silver Bird taxis is annoying. I was told it would take 15-20 minutes for a special order of a bluebird taxi, but when I went out to the street myself there were at least 3-4 taxes lined up and waiting for passengers. Also, they only allow you to register a single licence plate during your visit for pick up and drop off for free parking. I think in this day and age of modern transport apps (everyone in Jakarta uses Grab Taxi and Uber) this is a very outdated policy. Although they did agree to register my Uber cars, I was made to feel like this was an annoyance to them. the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Jakarta 2084 Guest Houses in Jakarta 364 Serviced Apartments in Jakarta 29 Hostels in Jakarta 15 Resorts in Jakarta 3 More about Jakarta One of the most densely populated cities in the world, Jakarta is the capital of Java and the gateway to Indonesia. It's the largest city in Southeast Asia and offers some of the best hotel facilities in the world, which is convenient for all the global commerce that moves through the region. Jakarta Airport, which is locally known as Soekarno Hatta International Airport, handles more than 30 million travelers a year and is linked to hotels in Central Jakarta via shuttle bus and taxi. The airport is only 20 kilometers from the city center, so travelers who want to stay near the airport have the option of booking a hotel near Jakarta airport . Central Jakarta is the busiest and most compact of this city and where much of Jakarta's business and finance are conducted. Hotels in Central Jakarta are convenient to major company headquarters, high-end shopping, restaurants, bars, and culturally significant landmarks like the National Monument , locally known as MONAS. Museums of note within Jakarta include the National Museum and the unique Puppet Museum . After dark, the nightlife in Jakarta is most active in Central and South Jakarta, with a range of nightclubs, live music venues, and 24-hour cafés. This diverse and exciting city truly has something for everyone. There’s much more to see and learn about Jakarta, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this city.
